meanings.definition: The quality or state of being venial.
meanings.sent1: Her veniality in forgetting my birthday was forgiven quickly.
meanings.sent2: The priest explained the concept of veniality to the congregation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his veniality in eating the last cookie, we all laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The veniality of his mistake was evident, but he still felt guilty.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience with our veniality made learning more enjoyable.

meanings.sent1: The child's veniality of stealing a candy bar was met with a gentle reprimand.
meanings.sent2: In the grand scheme of things, her veniality was easily forgiven.
meanings.sent3: His veniality of forgetting to water the plants led to some wilted leaves.
meanings.sent4: The veniality of his lie was apparent, but it still caused some harm.
meanings.sent5: The veniality of their argument seemed trivial the next day.
